TopicTitle: Suggestion for an additional flight revert point

Articles.Content:
Just a quick suggestion/request for a new revert point for flights. I often have everything set up on the launch pad and screw something up in the ascent. I can revert to "launch" but that is REALLY reverting to vehicle rollout. The actual launch may have come hours later after careful planning to set everything up to launch into the plane of a target. Can we PLEASE get a true revert to launch that would bring us back to the state everything was in at ignition? The existing "revert to launch" could be renamed something like "revert to rollout" and the revert to assembly would be left alone.

It's WAY aggravating to have to set everything up for launch again when I know that it's a flight problem I'm having and the pre-launch setup was fine.


Thanks!

Edited December 20, 2015 by Jeb was a good Kerbal
You can get all this set up and then quicksave before firing up. Will that work for you?
I try to remember to do that. I don't always remember to do that, though.
